title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without save file warnings
description: The system allows for shut down without providing any save file warnings.
OB: The system can be shut down without any prompt or warning about unsaved files.
EB: The system should provide a prompt with options to save the file or cancel the shutdown. Specifically, it should display a dialog box asking 'Do you want to save your file?' with options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel' which will halt the shutdown if selected.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Open a file in any application. 
2. Make some changes to the file. 
3. Try to shut down the system without saving the file.
